H0.text: Where on a coin would 'reeding' be found. Rim

H1.text: Where on a coin would 'reeding' be found. Obverse

H2.text: Where on a coin would 'reeding' be found. Reverse

H3.text: Where on a coin would 'reeding' be found. Edge

A4.text: Some coins, such as United States quarters and dimes, 1 euro, Australian 5, 10, 20 cents, 1 and 2 dollars, as well many other current coins, have reeded edges.

A5.text: This practice was made more difficult through the implementation of reeding by Isaac Newton in 1698, during his time as warden of the Royal Mint.
